t: Psalm 55
Prayer for the Destruction of the Treacherous.
For the choir director; on stringed instruments. A Maskil of David.
Give*pn ear to my prayer, O God; And*ln do not hide Yourself from my supplication.
Give*ln heed to me and answer me; I*ln am restless in my complaint and am surely distracted,
Because*ln of the voice of the enemy, Because*ln of the pressure of the wicked; For*ln they bring down trouble upon me And*ln in anger they bear a grudge against me.
My*ln heart is in anguish within me, And*ln the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
Fear*ln and trembling come upon me, And*ln horror has overwhelmed me.
I*ln said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I*ln would fly away and be at rest.
Behold,*ln I would wander far away, I*ln would lodge in the wilderness. Selah.
I*ln would hasten to my place of refuge From*ln the stormy wind and*i tempest.”
Confuse,*ln O Lord, divide their tongues, For*ln I have seen violence and strife in the city.
Day*ln and night they go around her upon her walls, And*ln iniquity and mischief are in her midst.
Destruction*ln is in her midst; Oppression*ln and deceit do not depart from her streets.
For*ln it is not an enemy who reproaches me, Then*ln I could bear it;*i Nor*ln is it one who hates me who has exalted himself against me, Then*ln I could hide myself from him.
But*ln it is you, a man my equal, My*ln companion and my familiar friend;
We*ln who had sweet fellowship together Walked*ln in the house of God in the throng.
Let*ln death come deceitfully upon them; Let*ln them go down alive to Sheol, For*ln evil is in their dwelling, in their midst.
As*ln for me, I shall call upon God, And*ln the Lord*s will save me.
Evening*ln and morning and at noon, I will complain and murmur, And*ln He will hear my voice.
He*ln will redeem my soul in peace from the battle which*i is*i against me, For*ln they are many who*i strive*i with me.
God*ln will hear and answer them— Even*ln the one who sits enthroned from of old— Selah. With*ln whom there is no change, And*ln who do not fear God.
He*ln has put forth his hands against those who were at peace with him; He*ln has violated his covenant.
His*ln speech was smoother than butter, But*ln his heart was war; His*ln words were softer than oil, Yet*ln they were drawn swords.
Cast*ln your burden upon the Lord*s and He will sustain you; He*ln will never allow the righteous to be shaken.
But*ln You, O God, will bring them down to the pit of destruction; Men*ln of bloodshed and deceit will not live out half their days. But*ln I will trust in You.
